## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control contains a collection of items. These items are of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> class. When providing default rendering, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control represents a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object using its <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property. In templated rendering, the template can render any desired property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object or associated data-bound object.
When you create a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDataBindEventHandler> delegate for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control, you identify the method that handles the event. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control notifies the handler when an item event is generated. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Unless you remove the delegate, the event handler is called whenever the event occurs.
